solution:
```python
import math

class Die:
    def __init__(self):
        self.faces = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
        self.top = 0
        self.bottom = 3
        self.north = 1
        self.east = 2
        self.south = 4
        self.west = 5

    def tumble(self, direction):
        if direction == 'north':
            self.top = self.north
            self.north = self.bottom
            self.bottom = self.south
            self.south = self.east
            self.east = self.west
            self.west = self.top
        elif direction == 'east':
            self.top = self.east
            self.east = self.north
            self.north = self.south
            self.south = self.west
            self.west = self.bottom
            self.bottom = self.top
        elif direction == 'south':
            self.top = self.south
            self.south = self.east
            self.east = self.west
            self.west = self.bottom
            self.bottom = self.north
            self.north = self.top
        elif direction == 'west':
            self.top = self.west
            self.west = self.south
            self.south = self.north
            self.north = self.bottom
            self.bottom = self.east
            self.east = self.top

def main():
    die = Die()
    while True:
        n = int(input())
        if n == 0:
            break
        for _ in range(n):
            direction = input()
            die.tumble(direction)
        print(die.faces[die.top - 1])

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```
